wikitext.*:
{{year-header}}
==January==
* '''[[20 January|20]]''' - The second ''[[The One Ring Celebration]]'' is held in [[wikipedia:Pasadena, California|Pasadena]].
* '''[[31 January|31]]''' - ''[[In Elven Lands]]'' is released.
* '''?''' - ''[[Amon Hen 197]]'' is published.
==February==
* '''[[4 February|4]]''' - Previews of [[The Lord of the Rings (musical)]] open in Toronto.
* '''[[19 February|19]]''' - Death of [[Wi Kuki Kaa]], actor originally cast as [[Ghân-buri-Ghân]] in ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King]]''.
* '''?''' - [[Vinyar Tengwar 47]] is published.

==March==
* '''[[2 March|2]]''' - ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Battle for Middle-earth II]]'' is published.
* '''[[17 March|17]]''' - [[Bob Papenbrook]], who voiced [[Théoden]] and [[Gimli]] in the video game ''[[The Lord of the Rings: War of the Ring]]'', dies.
* '''[[23 March|23]]''' - [[The Lord of the Rings (musical)]] at Toronto has its press opening.
* '''[[31 March|31]]''' - ''[[The Lord of the Rings 1954-2004|The Lord of the Rings 1954-2004: Scholarship in Honor of Richard E. Blackwelder]]'' is published.
* '''?''' - ''[[Amon Hen 198]]'' is published.
==April==
* '''[[7 April|7]]''' - The [[Tolkien Ensemble]] publish their collected work, ''[[Complete Songs and Poems]]''.
* '''[[11 April|11]]''' - ''[[Fellowship!]]'', an independent musical parody of ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'', wins the [http://www.laweekly.com/index.php?option=com_lawcontent&task=view&id=13103&Itemid=47 LA Weekly Theater Award] for ''Musical of the Year''.
==May==
* '''[[9 May|9]]''' - ''[[A Tolkienian Mathomium]]'' is published.
* '''[[19 May|19]]''' - ''[[The Ring of Words]]'' is published.
* '''?''' - ''[[Amon Hen 199]]'' is published.
==June==
* '''[[1 June|1]]''' - ''[[Tolkien Studies: Volume 3]]'' is published.
* '''[[11 June|11]]''' - Tim Hildebrandt, one of the renowned [[brothers Hildebrandt]], dies.
==July==
* '''[[1 July|1]]-[[4 July|4]]''' - [[The Gathering of the Fellowship 2006]] takes place in Toronto.
* '''[[2 July|2]]''' - [[Pieter Collier]] is awarded the ''1st Annual Northeast Tolkien Society Imperishable Flame Award 2006'' for his immense collection.
* '''[[13 July|13]]''' - ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The White Council]]'' is announced.
* '''[[14 July|14]]-[[16 July|16]]''' - [[Tolkien Thing|Tolkien Thing VIII]].
* '''[[28 July|28]]-[[30 July|30]]''' - ELF 2006.
* '''[[29 July|29]]''' - ''[[LOTRSBG: Legions of Middle-earth|The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game: Legions of Middle-earth]]'' is published.
* '''?''' - ''[[Amon Hen 200]]'' is published.

==August==
* '''[[4 August|4]]-[[7 August|7]]''' - [[Mythcon 37]].
* '''[[21 August|21]]-[[25 August|25]]''' - The Oxford Tolkien Conference at [[wikipedia:Exeter College, Oxford|Exeter College, Oxford]].
* '''?''' - ''[[Mallorn 44]]'' is published.

==September==
* '''[[11 September|11]]''' - Translator [[William Auld]] dies.
* '''[[15 September|15]]-[[17 September|17]]''' - [[Oxonmoot 2006]].
* '''[[18 September|18]]''' -  ''[[Children of Húrin]]'' is announced.
*'''[[26 September|26]]''' - Fantasy novel ''[[Here, There Be Dragons]]'', featuring [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] as a fictional character, is published.
* '''[[29 September|29]]''' - ''[[Tolkien and Modernity 1]]'' and ''[[Tolkien and Modernity 2]]'' are published.
* '''?''' - ''[[Amon Hen 201]]'' is published.

==October==
* '''[[10 October|10]]''' - ''[[J.R.R. Tolkien Encyclopedia: Scholarship and Critical Assessment]]'' is published.
==November==
* '''[[6 November|6]]''' - ''[[Peter Jackson: A Film-maker's Journey]]'' is published.
* '''[[10 November|10]]-[[12 November|12]]''' - [[Ring*Con 2006]].
* '''[[21 November|21]]''' - The [[RiffTrax]] commentary of ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring]]'' is released online.
* '''[[27 November|27]]''' - [[Anthony Jackson]], the Tale Bearer in the [[The Hobbit (1968 radio series)|1968 radio series of ''The Hobbit'']],  dies.
* '''?''' - ''[[Amon Hen 202]]'' is published.
==December==
* '''?''' - [[Vinyar Tengwar 48]] is published. 
==?==
* '''?''' - [[Audiobooks]] of ''[[The Fellowship of the Ring]]'', ''[[The Two Towers]]'' and ''[[The Return of the King]]'', read by [[Rob Inglis]], are published.
* '''?''' - Actor [[Tyroe Muhafidin]] is born.
